abstract.text: Computes the specified norm over an entire tensor or the specified axes.

The dimensions that the function uses to compute the norm. Set to
to specify that the function computes the norm over all dimensions.
Use this function to compute the norm of either an entire tensor or the axis or axes of a tensor.
For example, the following code defines a 3D tensor:
Define the
parameter as either
or
to specify that the operation computes the norm of the entire tensor. In this case, the norm is a scalar value, and the destination’s data layout must be a
with a size of
On return, the output descriptor contains a single value that is the square root of the sum of squares of each element in the tensor:
Specify an
of
to compute the norm along the second axis. In this case, the destination should be a matrix with a size that matches the zeroth and first dimensions of the source tensor:
On return, the output descriptor contains six values that are the norms of the slices along the second axis of the input tensor:
To compute the norm along more that one dimension, define the destination tensor with a size of the dimensions you’re not calculating over. For example, the following code defines an
with a value of
to compute the norm of dimensions zero and two:
On return, the output descriptor contains two values that are the norms of the top and bottom slices of the input tensor:

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Computes the Euclidean norm and writes the result to the output tensor.
Backpropogates gradients for the compute norm function.
Computes the specified norm over an entire tensor or the specified axes.
Backpropogates gradients for the compute norm function.
A constant that represents the L2 norm.
A structure that describes the shape, stride, data type, and, optionally, the memory location of an n-dimensional array.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.

media-3761079.alt: A diagram that depicts a 3D tensor as four 2D planes along the channel axis. Each plane is two elements high and three elements wide. The compute norm operation calculates separate norms for the six 4-element vectors along the channel axis.

media-3761082.alt: A diagram that depicts a 3D tensor as four 2D planes along the channel axis. Each plane is two elements high and three elements wide. The compute norm operation calculates separate norms for the pair of three-by-four matrices defined by the channel axis and the width axis.

media-3761084.alt: A diagram that depicts a 3D tensor as four 2D planes along the channel axis. Each plane is two elements high and three elements wide. The compute norm operation calculates a single value for the norm of the entire tensor.
